text: British Columbia Highway 23 is a highway in British Columbia that travels north-south between Highway 6 and the Mica Dam north of Revelstoke. The highway is formerly part of the Trans-Canada Highway between 1940 to 1962 when the Trans-Canada Highway passes through Rogers Pass in British Columbia. The highway flooded lower parts of the highway in 1982 when the Mica Dam was built during that time. Category:British Columbia provincial highways
title: British Columbia Highway 23
